input:

It could have put him one-on-one with the goalkeeper, but one of the defending players somehow manages to avert the threat. The ball is behind the touchline and Dortmund will take a throw-in.

46:08 Caption: There will be nothing more to see in the first half. The whistle blowing of Pavel Kralovec has ended it.
46:59 Caption: We are watching a run-of-the-mill game with only a few moments to ignite the crowd. The players surely can surely perform better, they just need to motivate themselves. The home fans will be really pleased with what they've seen from their players so far. Pass and move. The home side have played some possession football so far, while the visitors have been patient as they wait for the right moment to hit them on the break.

49:24 Caption: The match has just finished.
49:59 Caption: Although it hasn't been the most inspiring of performances so far, both teams have had their moments, and we might very well witness some thrilling football in the second half. The hosts are enjoying a clear advantage over the opposition. The home team are playing possession football, while the away team look to find a weakness in the opposition's defence mainly with their rapid counter-attacks.
    

    #######TASK 
    Provide a factually correct and detailed textual description of the game compiled from the information presented above from different sources, in more than 1000 words.
            "Cap:": represents the captions published in the online portal usually within 30 seconds of the event.
            "E:" represents events recorded exactly after the event happened.
    Don't mention sources of information like commentators or captions, write as if you saw them live.
summary:
In an electrifying clash on a crisp football evening, Dortmund triumphed decisively over Galatasaray with a final score of 4-1. The match was a fascinating spectacle marked by moments of superior skill, tactical acumen, and a slight dash of fortune that favored the home side, Dortmund.

The game kicked off with Dortmund in possession at the signal of referee Pavel Kralovec. The initial moments were tentative, as both teams explored each other’s formations and strategies. Barely a minute into the game, the ball was already out of play, prompting a quick throw-in from Dortmund. A sequence of clearances and throw-ins followed, largely finding no meaningful progression towards goal as both teams wrestled for early control.

As the game unfolded, Dortmund began showing their willingness to press forward. In the second minute, they earned a corner from a deflection and made several attempts to threaten the Galatasaray goal. These early forays were largely unsuccessful, with crucial clearances from the Galatasaray defense. The match echoed with the sounds of tactical adjustments and substitutions as each team sought to capitalize on slight openings.

Dortmund seemed increasingly confident as the minutes passed, pressing high and executing precision passes. A notable moment of the first half came at the ninth minute when a foul was committed by Galatasaray’s Osman Tarik Camdal, earning him a cautionary glance from the referee. Moments after this disruption, at the tenth minute, Dortmund were awarded another free-kick. They restarted promptly, although this lead to another foul, this time by Galatasaray, allowing Dortmund to regain their momentum.

The match's first notable shot on goal arrived in the 14th minute from Galatasaray’s player Wesley Sneijder. His close-range effort was a fierce reminder of the visitors’ capability, barely contained by the agile Dortmund goalkeeper, Roman Weidenfeller. Amidst the applause for this save, the game continued with relentless energy on both sides. Dortmund answered back with their offensive plays, marked by frequent throws, corners, and shots. However, it wasn't until later they could sharpen these attempts into tangible outcomes.

Dortmund finally saw their efforts pay off in the 38th minute. In a fluent move, Marco Reus collected a brilliant pass and deftly placed a low shot into the center of the net, scoring Dortmund's much-deserved opening goal. The Gratifying cheer from the Dortmund fans nearly drowned the frustration among the Galatasaray defense.

After the restart, Galatasaray struggled to position themselves effectively. Persistent attacks from Dortmund were only intermittented by Galatasaray's counter-attacks which failed to penetrate Dortmund's staunch defense. The margin between the teams widened even further in the second half, starting almost immediately with virtually unending offensive from Borussia Dortmund.

Galatasaray’s defense was tested anew, and they managed to fend off a corner in the first minute. These defensive resolves, however, showed signs of strain soon after. By the 10th minute of the second half, Dortmund doubled their lead. Ruiup Rakitarić initially missed a shot, yet Sokratis from Dortmund capitalized on the rebound, firing it low into the middle of the net to make it 2-0.

The next notable exchange occurred around the 18th minute when Galatasaray’s Hakan Balta received a yellow card for a late challenge. Even though Galatasaray managed to maintain possession and push forward, Blerim Dzemaili's offside around the mid-half nullified their best chance to score. Meanwhile, Dortmund didn’t relent in their attacks but were strategic, focusing on conserving energies while waiting for the right moment to decimate the opponent’s defense.

Galatasaray managed to claw back some hope in the 57th minute. Finding a rare lapse in the Dortmund defense, Wesley Sneijder delivered a corner into a well-positioned Hakan Balta who headed the ball into the left side of the goal. The score was narrowed to 2-1 but Dortmund fans’ anxiety didn’t last long.

A substitution in the 58th minute saw a fresh leg coming in for Dortmund. Ciro Immobile replaced Marco Reus and wasted no time to bolster Dortmund's advantage. By the 75th minute, Galatasaray’s defense finally caved to Dortmund’s relentless pressure. A wonderful lofted pass from Aubameyang found Immobile who, with precision, tore through the defense and netted a superb goal, making the score 3-1. This moment marked the downing of Galatasaray’s comeback hopes.

The sequence that followed saw a disheartened and weary Galatasaray making defensive blunders. Their woes were compounded when an unfortunate own goal sealed their fate. In an attempt to clear a dangerous low cross, Semih Kaya inadvertently turned the ball into his own net in the 80th minute, marking the score at 4-1.

The game was further fragmented with various substitutions, with Dortmund’s Bender being replaced by Adrian Ramos. Galatasaray also made their own adjustments, replacing Umut Bulut with Burak Yilmaz, and later, another player change to inject fresh energy. However, these efforts failed to alter the course of the game significantly.

As the clock ticked down, various attempts were made albeit both teams wore evident signs of fatigue. Blerim Dzemaili earned a yellow card near the end of regular time for a harsh tackle – a sign of increasing frustration among the Galatasaray ranks. The last few minutes were scattered with minor fouls and throw-ins, none of which significantly threatened the prevailing score-line.

The match concluded with a final score of Dortmund 4, Galatasaray 1. This game illustrated not just the technical superiority of Dortmund, but also a composed strategy, creative midfield play, and resilient defensive maneuvers that underscored their performance. Teked together, it showcased a team well-drilled and immensely effective, standing tall against a gallant yet overwhelmed Galatasaray side.

At the end of it, the home fans left the stadium in jubilation having witnessed a commanding display from their team, while Galatasaray had much to ponder over their defensive frailties and lapses heading into their subsequent games.
